data.title: File list order not correct in go to file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (128a4e3640c5375f7b0bc1cfd37f626481b1386f, 2017-09-12T05:10:59.101Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create folder structure something like this
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1032549/30316673-a096fe9c-97c5-11e7-95db-b789584a5c8f.png)
  - Command to quickly create the above files & folders
`mkdir -p node_modules1/bundle/lib/model/modules/ot1 && touch node_modules1/bundle/lib/model/modules/ot1/index.js`
`mkdir -p node_modules1/bundle/lib/model/modules/un1 && touch node_modules1/bundle/lib/model/modules/un1/index.js`
`mkdir -p node_modules1/bundle/lib/model/modules/modu1 && touch node_modules1/bundle/lib/model/modules/modu1/index.js`
`mkdir -p node_modules1/bundle/lib/model/modules/oddl1 && touch node_modules1/bundle/lib/model/modules/oddl1/index.js`

2. Now go to `Go to File... (âŒ˜T)`
3. Type `modu1/index.js` - this is the result
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1032549/30316807-fb9b4d0c-97c5-11e7-9337-33eaf3bad44e.png)
  * expected file is at 2nd

4. Type `un1/index.js` - this is the result
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1032549/30316838-17f57568-97c6-11e7-8427-5c558bb4430a.png)
  * expected file is at last

Here result eventually shows up but i expected it as the first result because all the results have common prefix and last result is the best match. This is just the sample but its a big problem where you have large number of files with same name under long path (like me). Sometimes the result is at 30-40 which makes me unable to use vscode for my case. 

This thing works absolutely fine in sublime text so you can see the expected result and compare.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Linux: Cannot open containing folder of a file

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16.0
- Commit: 787b31c0474e6165390b5a5989c9619e3e16f953
- OS Version: Ubuntu 17.10 Awkward Artful x64
- Linux Kernel Version: 4.12.0-12-generic
- Nautilus Version: 3.25.92

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Right click on a file
2. Select Open containing folder
3. After that, windows will not response to user and you must force quit.
4. A popup will display when forcing quit with below error:

``` javascript
Uncaught Exception:
Error: read ECONNRESET
    at exports._errnoException (util.js:1050:11)
    at Pipe.onread (net.js:581:26)
```

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Snippets are pretty flaky: Don't load, don't reload, don't have autocomplete priority
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.16.0 (1.16.0)
- OS Version: Sierra

I have a fairly simple snippet I'm testing:

```
    "Print to console": {
        "prefix": "log",
        "body": [
            "console.log( '$1', $1 );",
            "$2"
        ],
        "description": "Log output to console"
    },
```

## 1. On VSCode launch, snippets don't show up for ~30 seconds

![no-snippets-why](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79215/30311752-9f9c2c58-974b-11e7-9c17-c5036511feb0.gif)

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Create a snippet like the above
2. Open VSCode with a session with a Javascript file already open
3. Attempt to type the snippet

**Expected behavior**

The snippet loads and is usable

**Actual behavior**

The snippet doesn't load

## 2. Snippets randomly don't load at all (neither does any autocomplete)

![flakey-snippets](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79215/30311121-ac4b3bc2-9748-11e7-8f03-473867cb4f6f.gif)

Notice how I type `log` above the snippet line, and no snippets work. Even if autocompletion doesn't work here (not sure why?) snippets should load, since there's no overhead to loading the contents of a file.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Insert the contents of a snippet
2. Move the cursor above or below and type text that should trigger another snippet

**Expected behavior**

The snippet loads and autocompletes

**Actual behavior**

Nothing happens

## 3. Snippets randomly move in priority, autocomplete nonsense

![flakey-snippets](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79215/30311121-ac4b3bc2-9748-11e7-8f03-473867cb4f6f.gif)

When the autocomplete dropdown for `log` finally shows up, the first entry is **not** a snippet. Instead it's a baffling `var log: Log`. Note I have no variable named `log` anywhere in this file nor my project.

**Steps to reproduce**

1. Insert the prefix of a snippet

**Expected behavior**

The snippet is suggested to autocomplete

**Actual behavior**

Nonexistent variables are suggested to autocomplete

## 4. Snippets don't have priority in autocomplete

I tried naming a snippet with the prefix `"c"`. I've done this in all other editors that support snippets. I have it set to expand to the snippet posted at the top of this ticket. However, when I type `c`, a dozen variables that don't exist in my project come up first, as well as things that are syntactically impossible here, like `catch`.

![complete-not-good](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/79215/30311468-311bf2d2-974a-11e7-9105-8d167f0396dc.gif)

## 5. Snippets don't seem to live reload

I've used a few Vim snippet plugins, and they seem to reload instantly on saving the file. With VSCode, changing a snippet prefix in `javascript.json`, opening a `.js` file, and typing that prefix does nothing. On restart the snippet shows up.

-----

So far snippets in VSCode have been a mildly frustrating experience. Even Vim, which has notoriously bad autocomplete, doesn't seem to have these issues.

data.title: Fix duplicated {0} placeholders in new snippetsService messages
data.body: While translating VS Code to Hungarian, I noticed that there are two `{0}` placeholders in some new messages in `snippetsService.ts`. This PR fixes the problem.

data.title: Terminal file path clickability when colour changes midway through file path
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.0 (787b31c0474e6165390b5a5989c9619e3e16f953, 2017-09-06T16:27:49.891Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
vscode-eslint|dba|1.3.0
githistory|don|0.2.3
tslint|eg2|1.0.3
csharp|ms-|1.12.1
PowerShell|ms-|1.4.2



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Take the setup here: https://github.com/TypeStrong/ts-loader/tree/master/examples/fork-ts-checker
2. `npm install`
3. `npm start`
4. Observe lack of clickability on errors:

![screenshot 2017-09-12 06 12 25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1010525/30310016-40e1325e-9786-11e7-858d-7f5579deae38.png)

The reason for this is the colour change that the [`fork-ts-checker-webpack-plugin`](https://github.com/Realytics/fork-ts-checker-webpack-plugin) produces between the path ("...fileWithError.ts") and the line number / column number ("(2:7)")

You can work around this by supplying a custom formatter to fork-ts-checker-webpack-plugin; see here: https://blog.johnnyreilly.com/2017/09/fork-ts-checker-webpack-plugin-code.html

However, I wonder if VS Code should be able to cope with these colour changes and preserve "clickability".  What do you think?

data.title: Automatic Type Acquisition in VSCode on Ubuntu 14.04
data.body:
As posted [here](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/46137692/automatic-type-acquisition-in-vscode-on-ubuntu-14-04)


<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16.0
- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04 LTS
- installed nodejs and npm using apt-get with nodejs and npm packages respectively
- set "typescript.npm": "/usr/bin/npm"

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create test project directory _vscodetest_
2. _cd_ into _vscodetest_
3. open _vscode_ using _vscode ._ from terminal
4. add new JavaScript file _app.js_
5. add _jsconfig.json_ with the following configuration
```
{
    "typeAcquisition": {
        "include": [
            "jquery"
        ]
    }
}
```
6. In app.js start typing the following...
`var f = $('sdsf').`

When I hit '**.**', Intellisense just gives me '**$**' and '**f**'.

Also tried adding _package.json_ with
```
{
    "dependencies": {
    "jquery": "^3.2.1"
    }
}
```

data.title: Allow CompletionItem.detail to show syntax coloring
data.body: ## Feature request Provide an api for syntax coloring the `.detail` section in a `CompletionItem`. For example, in: The `function alert(message?: any): void` text would be colorized as `typescript` code. Two possible ideas on how this could be implemented: ## Proposal 1 Allow detail to be a `MarkdownString` ```ts export class CompletionItem { ... detail?: string | MarkdownString; ... } ``` **Pros** - Support other text markup such as bolding text **Cons** - Perhaps too flexible since the detail text should always be a single line and should not contain things like images or bullet points ## Proposal 2 Add a new language field for the detail string: ```ts export class CompletionItem { ... detail?: string; detailLanguage?: string; ... } ``` **Pros** - Standardized API that makes it very clear what the intended use case is **Cons** - Less flexibility I'm more in favor of something along the lines of the second proposal
